articles.headline: Apple Fills in Some Gaps With Latest iPhone
articles.snippet: Succumbing to consumer demand, Apple finally add basic features like voice commands, video capabilities, an improved camera and updated software.
articles.abstract: Succumbing to consumer demand, Apple finally add basic features like voice commands, video capabilities, an improved camera and updated software.
articles.lead_paragraph: Assessing the 2007 and 2008 iPhone models was an excruciating experience. You were torn in half  between your heart and your head.

articles.headline: Some Lawmakers Question Expanded Reach for the Fed
articles.snippet: One of the criticisms against President Obama’s regulatory plan is the Federal Reserve’s failure to stop the sale of subprime mortgages and other dangerous home loans that helped cause the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: One of the criticisms against President Obama’s regulatory plan is the Federal Reserve’s failure to stop the sale of subprime mortgages and other dangerous home loans that helped cause the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  No sooner had President Obama proposed a new regulatory road map for the country’s financial system on Wednesday than senior lawmakers expressed reservations about one of the plan’s central elements  to broadly expand the reach of the Federal Reserve to regulate financial risk across the entire system.

articles.headline: Older Recruits Challenge Army and Vice Versa
articles.snippet: The pace of over-35 enlistment in the Army jumped sharply in the first months of this year. Rising unemployment is a major reason, say Army officials, recruiters and training officers.
articles.abstract: The pace of over-35 enlistment in the Army jumped sharply in the first months of this year. Rising unemployment is a major reason, say Army officials, recruiters and training officers.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT SILL, Okla.  Pfc. Shane Dixon is known as Old Dix. Specialist Jason Ness goes by Gramps. Pfc. Christopher Batson’s nom de boot camp is Pops. None of them are over 40, but to the 18-year-old soldiers in basic training here, they are as ancient as a first generation Xbox.

articles.headline: Obama Poll Sees Doubt on Budget and Health Care
articles.snippet: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll found a distinct gulf between President Obama’s overall standing and how some of his key initiative are viewed.
articles.abstract: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll found a distinct gulf between President Obama’s overall standing and how some of his key initiative are viewed.
articles.lead_paragraph: A substantial majority of Americans say President Obama has not developed a strategy to deal with the budget deficit, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll, which also found that support for his plans to overhaul health care, rescue the auto industry and close the prison at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, falls well below his job approval ratings.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Dalia Sussman

articles.headline: An Insider Turned Agitator Is the Face of Iran’s Opposition
articles.snippet: Mir Hussein Moussavi is in some ways an accidental leader, a moderate anointed to represent a popular upwelling.
articles.abstract: Mir Hussein Moussavi is in some ways an accidental leader, a moderate anointed to represent a popular upwelling.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN  His followers have begun calling him “the Gandhi of Iran.” His image is carried aloft in the vast opposition demonstrations that have shaken Iran in recent days, his name chanted in rhyming verses that invoke Islam’s most sacred martyrs.

articles.headline: Keeping a True Identity Becomes a Battle Online
articles.snippet: With the rise of Facebook and Twitter, registering a simple Web address is no longer enough to plant one’s flag firmly in the online terrain.
articles.abstract: With the rise of Facebook and Twitter, registering a simple Web address is no longer enough to plant one’s flag firmly in the online terrain.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Since Facebook started giving out customized Web addresses like facebook.com/yourname last Friday, some 9.5 million people have rushed to grab their top choice.

articles.headline: Only a Hint of Roosevelt in Financial Overhaul
articles.snippet: The Obama plan -- and its overall effect on Wall Street’s modus operandi -- is not even close to what President Franklin Roosevelt accomplished during the Depression.
articles.abstract: The Obama plan -- and its overall effect on Wall Street’s modus operandi -- is not even close to what President Franklin Roosevelt accomplished during the Depression.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three quarters of a century ago, President Franklin Roosevelt earned the undying enmity of Wall Street when he used his enormous popularity to push through a series of radical regulatory reforms that completely changed the norms of the financial industry.

articles.headline: Banks Brace for Fight Over an Agency Meant to Bolster Consumer Protection
articles.snippet: Banks fear they could lose billions of dollars because of an agency proposed to ensure that consumers are protected.
articles.abstract: Banks fear they could lose billions of dollars because of an agency proposed to ensure that consumers are protected.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the economy was booming, banks doled out credit to consumers like candy. People who could never afford to live their dream found pay option adjustable rate mortgages and other easy-access loans just a signature away. Credit cards put the pain of payment off to another day  never mind the fees hidden in the fine print.
articles.byline: By Andrew Martin and Louise Story

articles.headline: Estimate Places Natural Gas Reserves 35% Higher
articles.snippet: The jump is partly because of new drilling technologies, and raises the possibility of the resource becoming an important transition fuel.
articles.abstract: The jump is partly because of new drilling technologies, and raises the possibility of the resource becoming an important transition fuel.
articles.lead_paragraph: Thanks to new drilling technologies that are unlocking substantial amounts of natural gas from shale rocks, the nation’s estimated gas reserves have surged by 35 percent, according to a study due for release on Thursday.

articles.headline: As Confrontation Deepens, Iran's Path Is Unclear
articles.snippet: As another day of defiance, concessions and ominous threats transfixed Tehran, the situation had all the hallmarks of a standoff.
articles.abstract: As another day of defiance, concessions and ominous threats transfixed Tehran, the situation had all the hallmarks of a standoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN  As another day of defiance, concessions and ominous threats transfixed Iran’s capital, it was increasingly apparent on Thursday that there was no clear path out of a deepening confrontation that has posed the most serious challenge to the Islamic republic in its 30-year history.
articles.byline: By Nazila Fathi and Michael Slackman

articles.headline: In Indian Airline’s Troubles, a Cautionary Tale
articles.snippet: Soaring fuel prices and too-rapid expansion contributed to the financial difficulties of Kingfisher and other carriers.
articles.abstract: Soaring fuel prices and too-rapid expansion contributed to the financial difficulties of Kingfisher and other carriers.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI  Kingfisher Airlines of India promised passengers the royal treatment  flight attendants so comely they were called “flying models,” full meals even on short flights and curbside valets to carry their bags.
articles.byline: By Heather Timmons and Vikas Bajaj
